intro: Theodorea canescens, commonly known as the woolly theodorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Theodorea canescens is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
